extendedIngredients.name: cooked rice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 c. of cold cooked rice, sprinkled with a little water and stirred to separate the grains
metaInformation: with a little water and stirred to separate the grains

extendedIngredients.name: peanut oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tbsps. of peanut (or soya or vegetable) oil

extendedIngredients.name: peas
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ c. of sweet peas (thawed and drained if frozen)

extendedIngredients.name: pork
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ c. of chopped char siu pork (see note at the end)

extendedIngredients.name: sausage
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pc. of Chinese sausage (longganisa Macau), roughly chopped

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.originalString: a bunch of scallions (onion leaves), cut into one-inch lengths

extendedIngredients.name: sesame seed oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: a drizzle of sesame seed oil

extendedIngredients.name: shrimps
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ c. of chopped fresh shrimps

recipes.title: Yang Chow (Yeung Chow, Yang Zhou) fried rice
recipes.instructions: InstructionsMethod 1: Heat the cooking oil in a wok. Add the pork and sausage and stir fry for about 30 seconds or just until heated through. Add the shrimps and peas and cook until the shrimps change color. Add the rice. Season with salt and pepper; pour in the oyster sauce, if using. Stir gently but thoroughly and cook until the rice is hot. Pour in the beaten eggs. When the eggs are partially set, sit and continue cooking until the eggs are cooked through. Drizzle with sesame seed oil and stir before serving.Method 2: Heat the cooking oil, pour in the eggs and cook just until set. Lift with a slotted spoon and cut into fine strips. Continue as above. Add the eggs just before drizzling with sesame seed oil.

steps.step: Heat the cooking oil in a wok.
Add the pork and sausage and stir fry for about 30 seconds or just until heated through.
Add the shrimps and peas and cook until the shrimps change color.
Add the rice. Season with salt and pepper; pour in the oyster sauce, if using. Stir gently but thoroughly and cook until the rice is hot.
Pour in the beaten eggs. When the eggs are partially set, sit and continue cooking until the eggs are cooked through.

analyzedInstructions.name: Drizzle with sesame seed oil and stir before serving.Method 2

steps.step: Heat the cooking oil, pour in the eggs and cook just until set. Lift with a slotted spoon and cut into fine strips. Continue as above.
Add the eggs just before drizzling with sesame seed oil.
